'''Shawn Michael Grate''' (born August 8, 1976<ref name=WMFD_69898>{{cite news|last1=Jackman|first1=Jay|title=23 Felony Count Indictments Against Convicted Serial Killer|url=http://www.northcentralohio.com/news/single.asp?story=69898|accessdate=23 September 2016|work=WMFD}}</ref>) is an [[Demography of the United States|American]] convicted [[serial killer]] who was convicted on two counts of [[Aggravation (law)|aggravated]] [[murder]] on May 7th, 2018, in [[Ashland County, Ohio|Ashland County]], [[Ohio]].
==Biography== Grate graduated from [[River Valley High School (Caledonia, Ohio)|River Valley High School]] in 1995.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.richlandsource.com/news/grate-s-ex-wife-releases-statement/article_7ebfacc8-7b57-11e6-ab9d-63cfe72c082d.html |title=Grate's ex-wife releases statement |last=Carr |first=Dillon |date=15 September 2016 |website=Richland Source |publisher= |access-date=30 November 2017 |quote= }}</ref>
A [[grand jury]] [[indict]]ed Grate on two counts of [[Aggravation (law)|aggravated]] [[murder]] in the deaths of two women, Stacey Stanley and Elizabeth Griffith, and the [[kidnapping]] and multiple [[Rape|sexual assaults]] of an unidentified woman whose [[9-1-1|911]] call to [[Ashland, Ohio|Ashland]] police led to Grate's arrest on September 13, 2016. In court documents, her name has been [[Redaction|redacted]]; she is being referred to as "Jane Doe". In total, Grate was indicted on 23 counts, all first, second, or third-degree [[Felony|felonies]]; lesser charges include [[breaking and entering]], [[burglary]], and [[tampering with evidence]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Tunnell|first1=Christopher|title=PDF Released: Grate Indictment 22 Sept 16|url=https://twitter.com/AshlandCoPros/status/779036910719229952|website=Twitter|accessdate=23 September 2016}}</ref> He was represented in court by [[Public defender|court-appointed attorney]] Rolf Whitney,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sams|first1=Dylan|title=Grate pleads not guilty to two counts of murder, one count kidnapping|url=http://www.times-gazette.com/local%20news/2016/09/19/grate-pleads-not-guilty-to-two-counts-of-murder-one-count-kidnapping|accessdate=26 September 2016|work=Ashland Times-Gazette}}</ref> who entered a plea of not guilty on all charges on behalf of Grate.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dunning|first1=Shanice|title=Suspected serial killer Shawn Grate pleads not guilty|url=http://www.cleveland19.com/story/33276947/suspected-serial-killer-shawn-grate-to-be-arraigned-thurs|accessdate=10 October 2016|work=Cleveland 19 News}}</ref> In a press interview, however, Grate confessed to five murders.<ref name=QAndACleveland19>{{cite news|last1=Nist|first1=Cassie|title=Q&A from jail: Shawn Grate says his victims didn't want to live|url=http://www.cleveland19.com/story/33343964/suspected-serial-killer-shawn-grate-grants-interview-from-ashland-county-jail|accessdate=10 October 2016|work=Cleveland 19 News}}</ref> Grate's attorneys later filed a plea of not guilty by reason of insanity.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Steer|first1=Jen|title=Accused Ashland serial killer pleads insanity|url=http://fox8.com/2016/12/28/accused-ashland-serial-killer-pleads-insanity/|accessdate=4 January 2017|work=WJW Fox 8 Cleveland|date=28 December 2016}}</ref> His trial date was set for November 6, 2017,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mills|first1=Emily|title=Shawn Grate's trial date set for next November|url=http://www.mansfieldnewsjournal.com/story/news/2016/10/31/shawn-grates-trial-date-set-next-november/93086374/|accessdate=7 November 2016|work=Mansfield News Journal|date=31 October 2016}}</ref> and was later delayed to April 9, 2018.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Busbey|first1=Tim|title=Accused Ashland serial killer Shawn Grate's trial delayed until April 9|url=http://www.richlandsource.com/ashland_source/accused-ashland-serial-killer-shawn-grate-s-trial-delayed-until/article_3dda90c4-8c31-11e7-81ea-7b54d0d5f78e.html|accessdate=29 August 2017|work=Richland Source|date=28 August 2017|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Sams|first1=Dylan|title=Trial for Shawn Grate rescheduled for April 2018|url=https://www.times-gazette.com/local%20news/2017/08/28/trial-for-shawn-grate-rescheduled-for-april-2018|accessdate=29 August 2017|work=Ashland Times-Gazette|date=28 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Trial of accused serial killer Shawn Grate delayed until next year|url=http://www.mansfieldnewsjournal.com/story/news/2017/08/28/trial-accused-serial-killer-grate-delayed/607622001/|accessdate=29 August 2017|work=Mansfield News Journal|date=28 August 2017}}</ref>
Ashland County [[prosecutor]] Christopher R. Tunnell said that given the "...depraved actions and the gruesome evidence", he would seek the [[death penalty]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Ashland prosecutor seeks death penalty against suspected serial killer|url=http://nbc4i.com/2016/09/22/ashland-prosecutor-seeks-death-penalty-against-suspected-serial-killer/|accessdate=26 September 2016|work=WCMH-TV NBC4}}</ref>
Shawn Grate has also been charged in the deaths of his former girlfriend Candice Cunningham and Rebekah Leicy in neighboring [[Richland County, Ohio|Richland County]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Convicted murderer Shawn Grate pleads not guilty to Richland County charges|url=https://eu.mansfieldnewsjournal.com/story/news/2018/09/13/convicted-murderer-shawn-grate-pleads-not-guilty-richland-charges/1291554002/|accessdate=14 September 2018|work=Mansfield News Journal|date=13 September 2018}}</ref> and has not yet been charged in the death of an unknown woman who died between 2005 and 2006 who was found in 2007 in [[Marion County, Ohio|Marion County]].<ref name=NBC4_9_20_16>{{cite news|title=Ashland killer connection reopens 2015 case|url=http://nbc4i.com/2016/09/20/ashland-killer-connection-reopens-2015-case/|accessdate=26 September 2016|work=WCMH-TV NBC4}}</ref> However, in the second of two letters he sent to [[Cleveland]] news station [[WEWS-TV|WEWS]] (News 5 Cleveland) reporter Megan Hickey, Grate attributed his motives to "[[Welfare|government assistance]]", writing that it took his victims' minds. "They were already dead, just their bodies were flopping wherever it can flop but their minds were already dead! The state took their minds. Once they started receiving their monthly checks". Grate claimed he once received a $197 [[Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program|food card]] and that he, "Never was able to receive any encouragement, though many bodies received 700".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hickey|first1=Megan|title=Suspected serial killer Shawn Grate reveals "why" he murdered victims in letters to News 5|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/news/local-news/suspected-serial-killer-shawn-grate-reveals-why-he-murdered-victims-in-letters-to-news-5|accessdate=6 October 2016|work=WEWS News 5 Cleveland}}</ref>
After Grate had given out details of the murders to two different news organizations while in custody, attorneys for the defense and prosecution jointly requested and obtained a [[gag order]] preventing Grate from communicating any further with the media.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Barbash|first1=Fred|title=The twisted confessions of Shawn Grate, who says he killed 5 women|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2016/10/14/the-twisted-confessions-of-shawn-grate-who-says-he-killed-5-women/|accessdate=24 October 2016|work=The Washington Post}}</ref> On January 6, 2017, a competency hearing determined Grate is fit to stand trial.<ref>{{cite news|title=Grate competent to stand trial|url=http://www.times-gazette.com/local%20news/2017/01/06/grate-competent-to-stand-trial|accessdate=10 January 2017|work=Ashland Times-Gazette|date=6 January 2017}}</ref> An evaluation released March 6 based on a January 17 assessment to evaluate Grate's claim of insanity declared that he was not insane at the time the crimes were committed.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Caudill|first1=Mark|title=Grate ruled competent to stand trial|url=http://www.mansfieldnewsjournal.com/story/news/local/2017/01/06/grate-ruled-competent-stand-trial/96238260/|accessdate=10 January 2017|work=Mansfield News Journal|date=6 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Caudil|first1=Mark|title=Evaluation: Shawn Grate not insane at time of killings|url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/local/ohio/evaluation-shawn-grate-not-insane-at-time-of-killings/420130608|accessdate=20 March 2017|work=WKYC|date=6 March 2017}}</ref> Grate's counsel then withdrew the plea of not guilty by reason of insanity on April 7, 2017.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Busbey|first1=Tim|title=Shawn Grate's attorneys withdraw insanity plea|url=http://www.richlandsource.com/ashland_source/shawn-grate-s-attorneys-withdraw-insanity-plea/article_a3fd8f4c-1bab-11e7-96da-53a4563772d1.html|accessdate=19 April 2017|work=Richland Source|date=7 April 2017|language=en}}</ref>
[[File:House at 363 Covert Court, Ashland, OH.jpg|thumb|363 Covert Court in Ashland, OH where Grate was arrested, a public memorial is in front of the house.]] In a settlement with the owner, the City of Ashland obtained ownership of the house where Grate was apprehended, two bodies were discovered, and a kidnapped woman was rescued by police. The city is pursuing a federal grant with the intention of demolishing the house.<ref name="Ashland Times-Gazette">{{cite news|last1=Sams|first1=Dylan|title=Pump House to sign properties over to city in foreclosure case|url=http://www.times-gazette.com/news/20170912/pump-house-to-sign-properties-over-to-city-in-foreclosure-case|accessdate=13 September 2017|work=Ashland Times-Gazette|date=12 September 2017|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Sams|first1=Dylan|title=Ashland wants to demolish the houses where Shawn Grate was found last year|url=https://www.times-gazette.com/local%20news/2017/07/14/ashland-wants-to-demolish-the-houses-where-shawn-grate-was-found-last-year|accessdate=17 July 2017|agency=Ashland Times-Gazette|date=14 July 2017}}</ref>
“There is a settlement agreement among the parties that essentially obligates the Pump House to transfer all property that is the subject of this action to the city of Ashland and transfer their title there too, provided that the city pays off the sums owed to the county for delinquent taxes and to the Muskingum Watershed District,” said Andrew Bush, assistant law director for the city of Ashland.<ref name="Ashland Times-Gazette"/>
== Trials == Grate's trial for the Ashland crimes began with two weeks of jury selection on April 9, 2018.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNaull|first1=Courtney|title=Jury selection begins in Shawn Grate case|url=http://www.richlandsource.com/ashland_source/jury-selection-begins-in-shawn-grate-case/article_4a052884-3bed-11e8-9772-f7342d9a5bf9.html|accessdate=9 April 2018|work=Richland Source|date=9 April 2018|language=en}}</ref> The trial began with opening statements on April 23.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sams|first1=Dylan|title=Prosecutor: Shawn Grate case “not a whodunnit”|url=http://www.times-gazette.com/news/20180423/shawn-grate-not-whodunnit-case-prosecutor-says|accessdate=23 April 2018|work=Ashland Times-Gazette|date=23 April 2018|language=en}}</ref> On May 2, Grate pleaded guilty to 15 of the charges against him.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sams|first1=Dylan|title=Accused killer Grate pleads guilty to 15 non-murder charges|url=http://www.times-gazette.com/news/20180502/accused-killer-grate-pleads-guilty-to-15-non-murder-charges|accessdate=3 May 2018|agency=Ashland Times-Gazette|date=2 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Accused Ashland serial killer Shawn Grate pleads guilty to several charges|url=http://fox8.com/2018/05/02/accused-ashland-serial-killer-shawn-grate-pleading-guilty-to-several-charges/|accessdate=3 May 2018|work=WJW Fox 8 Cleveland|date=2 May 2018}}</ref> On May 7, Grate was found guilty of murdering Stacey Stanley and Elizabeth Griffith.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jury finds Shawn Grate guilty of murder, sexual assault in Ohio|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/ohio-serial-killer-case-sent-jury-death-two-women-n872001|accessdate=8 May 2018|work=NBC NEWS|date=7 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Accused serial killer Shawn Grate found guilty of aggravated murder, kidnapping|url=http://fox8.com/2018/05/07/closing-arguments-set-for-today-in-trial-of-accused-serial-killer/|accessdate=8 May 2018|work=WJW Fox 8 Cleveland|date=7 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Sams|first1=Dylan|title=GRATE TRIAL: Guilty on all 8 counts|url=http://www.times-gazette.com/news/20180507/grate-trial-guilty-on-all-8-counts|accessdate=8 May 2018|work=Ashland Times-Gazette|date=7 May 2018|language=en}}</ref> On June 1, Grate was sentenced to death.<ref name="News Journal Death Sentence">{{cite news|title=Crowd in court applauds death sentence for Shawn Grate|url=https://eu.mansfieldnewsjournal.com/story/news/2018/06/01/shawn-grate-sentenced-death-2016-murders/645107002/|accessdate=1 June 2018|work=Mansfield News Journal|date=1 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Sams |first1=Dylan |title=Judge sentences Grate to death, families mourn |url=http://www.times-gazette.com/news/20180601/judge-sentences-grate-to-death-in-two-murders |accessdate=1 June 2018 |work=Ashland Times-Gazette |date=1 June 2018 |language=en}}</ref> An initial execution date was set upon conviction for [[List of offenders executed in the United States in 2018|September 13, 2018]],<ref name="News Journal Death Sentence"/> however the execution was stayed due to a pending appeal to the Ohio Supreme Court<ref name=SourceSept18>{{cite news |last1=McNaull |first1=Courtney |title=Serial killer Shawn Grate case resumes on Sept. 25 |url=https://www.richlandsource.com/news/serial-killer-shawn-grate-case-resumes-on-sept/article_4b37d216-bab8-11e8-a225-977fabd6e654.html |accessdate=2 November 2018 |work=Richland Source |issue=24 September 2018 |language=en}}</ref>.
Defense counsel in the trial were Robert Whitney and Rolf Whitney. The prosecution team was Ashland Prosecutor Chris Tunnell, Medina County Assistant Prosecutor Michael McNamara and Special Prosecutor Mark Weaver.<ref name="News Journal Death Sentence"/>
== Victims == ===Kidnapping Victim=== While Grate slept, the victim identified by the indictment only as "Jane Doe"<ref name=WMFD_69898 /> called 911 from the Ashland house where Grate had held her for three days. She was safely rescued by Ashland police. Because she was the victim of a sexual assault, police declined to reveal her identity.<ref>{{cite web|title=What we know: Shawn Grate tied to 5 deaths, 1 abduction|url=http://www.cincinnati.com/story/news/crime/2016/09/20/shawn-grate-what-we-know/90731792/|website=Cincinnati.com|publisher=USA Today|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> Grate claims he did not plan to kill her and that they were going to get married.<ref name=QAndACleveland19 />
===Stacey Stanley A.K.A. Stacey Hicks=== Stanley's family had reported her missing the week before Grate was arrested. Her body was found at the Ashland house where Grate was arrested.<ref name=time_9-20-16>{{cite news|last1=Samuelson|first1=Kate|title=Man Linked to at Least 5 Women's Deaths Is 'Obviously a Serial Killer,' Sheriff Says|url=http://time.com/4501103/shawn-grate-murder-kidnapping-obviously-serial-killer/|accessdate=20 September 2016|work=TIME}}</ref> She is also known as Stacy Hicks. An autopsy concluded she was strangled to death.<ref name=WEWSjan17>{{cite news|last1=Jones|first1=Bob|title=Autopsy report reveals two of Shawn Grate's alleged victims were strangled to death|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/news/local-news/oh-ashland/autopsy-report-reveals-two-of-shawn-grates-alleged-victims-were-strangled-to-death|accessdate=4 January 2017|work=WEWS|date=4 January 2017}}</ref>
===Elizabeth Griffith=== Griffith had been missing for about a month before Grate was arrested. Her body was found at the Ashland house where Grate was arrested.<ref name=time_9-20-16 /> An autopsy concluded she was strangled to death.<ref name=WEWSjan17 />
===Candice Cunningham=== Grate led police to what he claimed was Cunningham's body in neighboring [[Richland County, Ohio|Richland County]] on the day of his arrest.<ref>{{cite news|last1=L'Heureux|first1=Catie|title=A Serial Killer's Victim Made a 911 Call That Helped Police Link the Cases of 5 Murdered Women|url=http://nymag.com/thecut/2016/09/5-women-linked-to-serial-killer-shawn-grate-in-ohio.html|accessdate=20 September 2016|work=New York Magazine}}</ref> Police found the body behind a house that had previously burned down. The Richland County Sheriff's office officially confirmed that the body found was Cunningham's on November 1, 2016.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Carr|first1=Dillon|title=Candice Cunningham identified as 3rd victim in Grate case|url=http://www.richlandsource.com/news/candice-cunningham-identified-as-rd-victim-in-grate-case/article_608d8396-a042-11e6-86bd-0ff8b86074df.html|accessdate=7 November 2016|work=Richland Source|date=1 November 2016}}</ref>
===Rebekah Leicy=== Based on information supplied by Grate, police have reopened the investigation into Leicy's death. Her body was found in March 2015, and her death was originally ruled a drug overdose.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Whitmire|first1=Lou|title=Grate provides Mansfield police with tips in Leicy case|url=http://www.mansfieldnewsjournal.com/story/news/2016/09/19/mansfield-police-searching-evidence-leicy-investigation/90715336/|accessdate=20 September 2016|work=Mansfield News Journal}}</ref> Grate says he strangled her after she stole $4 from him in a bar.<ref name=QAndACleveland19 />
===Marion County Victim "Dana"===
{{main|Marion County Jane Doe (2007)}}
Grate claims to have killed another woman who was found dead in [[Marion County, Ohio|Marion County]] in 2007 and never identified.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Barbash|first1=Fred|title='He's obviously a serial killer': Deaths of at least 5 women now linked, probed by Ohio police|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2016/09/20/hes-obviously-a-serial-killer-deaths-of-at-least-5-women-now-linked-probed-by-ohio-police/|accessdate=20 September 2016|work=The Washington Post}}</ref> He has stated he believes her name was Dana.<ref name=QAndACleveland19 /> In January 2018, isotope analysis indicated she was likely from the southern United States. <ref>{{cite news|last1=Volpenhein|first1=Sarah|title=New tests could help identify alleged Shawn Grate victim in Marion County|url=https://www.marionstar.com/story/news/crime/2018/04/11/new-leads-naming-first-grate-victim/507374002/|accessdate=12 April 2018|work=Marion Star|date=11 April 2018|language=en}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Grate, Shawn}} [[Category:1976 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:American serial killers]] [[Category:American kidnappers]] [[Category:American criminals]] [[Category:American people convicted of murder]] [[Category:Male serial killers]] [[Category:People convicted of murder by Ohio]] [[Category:Prisoners sentenced to death by Ohio]]

page.title: Sheikh Hamdan bin Rashid Al Maktoum Award for Medical Sciences

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2015}} {{ref improve|date=May 2014}} {{Infobox organization | name = Sheikh Hamdan bin Rashid Al Maktoum Award for Medical Sciences
جائزة الشيخ حمدان بن راشد آل مكتوم للعلوم الطبية | former name = | bgcolor = | fgcolor = | image = | image_border = | size = 300px | alt = | caption = | map = | msize = | malt = | mcaption = | map2 = | motto = | predecessor = | successor = | formation = | extinction = | type = | status = | purpose = | location = Block C, Level II, Nashwan Bld, Bur Dubai, Dubai, United Arab of Emirates. | country = [[UAE]] | membership = | language = | general = | leader_title = Secretary General | leader_name = [[Najib Al Khaja]] | leader_title2 = Executive Director | leader_name2 = [[Abdulla bin Souqat]] | leader_title3 = Date of Establishment | leader_name3 = 10 April 1999 | leader_title4 = | leader_name4 = | key_people = | main_organ = | affiliations = | budget = | num_staff = | num_volunteers = | website = {{URL|http://www.hmaward.org.ae}} | remarks = }} The '''Sheikh Hamdan bin Rashid Al Maktoum Award for Medical Sciences''' was established on 10 April 1999, when Sheikh [[Maktoum bin Rashid Al Maktoum]], UAE Vice President, and Prime Minister and Ruler of Dubai, issued the Supreme Decree No. (5) to establish the award, with the objective of honouring scientists from every part of the world who pursue medical research that serves the larger interests of humanity. The award recognizes the importance of scientific research in the [[United Arab Emirates|UAE]], and funds domestic health research.{{Citation needed|date=April 2014}} ==Profile== All contributors to the alleviation of sufferings of patients and care for community health are eligible for the award. ===The first awards=== The topics of the first term, 1999-2000 were selected to be for Grand Hamdan International Award - Cardiovascular Medicine and Surgery, and for Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence - Recombinant Vaccines in Infectious Diseases, Genetics in Diabetes, Therapy in Leukemia. *International Awards :*Grand Hamdan International Award: ::*[[Denton Cooley]] (US) - Cardiovascular Medicine and Surgery :*Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence: ::*[[Andrew James McMichael]] (UK) - Recombinant vaccines in infectious diseases ::*[[C. Ronald Kahn]] (US) - Genetics in Diabetes ::*[[Dr. Anne Dejean]] (France) and [[Dr. Pier Paolo Pandolfi de Rinaldis]] (France) - Therapy in Leukemia :*Hamdan Award for Volunteers in Humanitarian Medical Services: ::*[[Abdul Sattar Edhi]] (Pakistan) ::*[[Red Crescent Society of the United Arab Emirates]] (UAE) *UAE Awards :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Individuals Working in the Field of Medicine & Health: ::*[[Dr. Abdul Rahim Jaffar]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Joseph Muscat Baron]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Jumaa Khalfan Belhoul]] (UAE) ::*[[Late Dr Mohammed bin Habib Al Redha]] (UAE) ::*[[Late Dr. Amina Kazim]] (UAE) ::*[[Sultan bin Ali Al Owais]] (UAE) ===The second awards=== The topics of the second term, 2001-2002 were selected to be for Grand Hamdan International Award - Obstetrics & Gynecology, and for Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence - Gene Therapy of Inherited Disorders, Pathogenesis and Therapy of Autoimmune Disorders, Apoptosis in Disease & Health. Infertility is probably the single most common ailment to afflict men and women of reproductive age. It has been estimated that the level of infertility in the community is probably one out of every seven couples of reproductive age. *International Awards :*Grand Hamdan International Award: ::*[[Robert Edwards (physiologist)|Robert Edwards]] (UK) - Obstetrics & Gynecology (Infertility) :::In 2010, Edwards was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine "for the development of in vitro fertilization". :*Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence: ::*[[Martin Raff]] (UK) - Apoptosis in Disease & Health ::*[[William French Anderson]] (US) - Gene Therapy of Inherited Disorders ::*[[Prof. Ake Lernmark]] (US) and [[Prof. Foo Yew Liew]] (UK) - Pathogenesis and Therapy of Autoimmune Disorders :*Hamdan Award for Volunteers in Humanitarian Medical Services: ::*[[Al Maktoum Foundation]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Ghassan bin Mohammed Shahroor]] (Syria) ::*[[Sharadkumar Dicksheet]] (India) ::*[[William Magee (physician)]] (US) *Arab World Awards :*Hamdan Award for the Best Medical College/Institute or Centre in the Arab World: ::*[[Faculty of Medicine, American University of Beirut]] (Lebanon) ::*[[Faculty of Medicine, Uninversity of Gezira]] (Republic of Sudan) *UAE Awards :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Individuals Working in the Field of Medicine & Health: ::*[[Dr. Al Sayed Jaafar Al Sayed M. Al Sharaf]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Saud Kayed Al Qassimi]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Zainab Abdulla Kazim]] (UAE) ::*[[Mr. Fareed Abdulla Saleh Al Gurq]] (UAE) ::*[[Mr. Sulaiman bin Ahmad Al Houqani]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for Original Research Paper Published in HMJ from inside and outside UAE: ::*[[Dr. Frank Christopher Howarth]] (KSA) ::*[[Dr. Jaffar Ali bin Abdullah]] (KSA) ===The third awards=== The topics of the third term, 2003-2004 were selected to be for Grand Hamdan International Award - Renal Diseases: Pathogenesis & Management, and for Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence - Emerging Viral & Prion Diseases, Minimally Invasive Surgical Technology, Prevention & Non-invasive Therapy of Gastrointestinal Disorders. Renal disease affects people of all ages and lead to considerable distress and early death for a significant number of persons. Kidney disease appears at all ages with newborn babies being affected with congenital and genetic problems, young children developing kidney problems as a primary condition or as a complication of other disease. The elderly, especially, are prone to develop kidney problems and renal failure as their health deteriorates. *International Awards :*Grand Hamdan International Award: ::*[[Robert William Schrier]] (US) - Renal Diseases - Pathogenesis & Management :*Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence: ::*[[Adriano Aguzzi]] (Switzerland) - Emerging Viral & Prion Diseases ::*[[Prof. John Forte]] (US) - Prevention & Non-invasive Therapy of Gastrointestinal Disorders ::*[[Ara Darzi, Baron Darzi of Denham]] (UK) - Minimally Invasive Surgical Technology :*Hamdan Award for Volunteers in Humanitarian Medical Services: ::*[[Human Relief Agency]] (Egypt) ::*[[Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Humanitarian and Charity Establishment]] (UAE) ::*[[Adeebul Hasan Rizvi]] (Pakistan) ::*[[Palestine Children's Relief Fund]] (Palestine) *Arab World Awards :*Hamdan Award for the Best Medical College/Institute or Centre in the Arab World: ::*[[Kaser Al Aini Medical College, Cairo University]] (Egypt) ::*[[King Faisal Specialist Hospital and Research Centre]] (KSA) *UAE Awards :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Individuals Working in the Field of Medicine & Health: ::*[[Dr. Hussein Mohamed Habib]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Jumaa Bilal Fairouz]] (UAE) ::*[[Rafia Ghubash]] (UAE) ::*[[Mr. Haj Saeed bin Ahmed AlLootah]] (UAE) ::*[[Mr. Abdulrahman Ali Abdullah Ahli]] (UAE) ::*[[Late Dr. Mahmoud Kazem]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for an Outstanding Clinical Department in the Public Sector in UAE: ::*[[Department of Cardiac Surgery, Al Mafraq Hospital, Abu Dhabi]] (UAE) ::*[[Emergency & Critical Care Department, Rashid Hospital, Dubai]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for Original Research Paper Published in HMJ from inside and outside UAE: ::*[[Dr. Alice Abd El Aleem]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Mohammad Amjad Kamal]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Omar Trad]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Sarfraz Ahmad]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Valsamma Eapen]] (UAE) ::*[[Prof. Senarth Dissanayake]] (UAE) ===The fourth awards=== The topics of the fourth term, 2005-2006 were selected to be for Grand Hamdan International Award - Molecular and Cellular Pathology of Neurological Disorders, and for Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence - Biology of Aging, Cytokines in Pathogenesis & Therapy of Diseases, Pathogenesis of Hypertension. Neurological disorders are more prominent today than at perhaps any other time in history. Neurological disorders affect the central nervous system, the peripheral nervous system, and the autonomic nervous system. Scientists use the tools of molecular biology, biochemistry and cell biology to probe into and advance in understanding the processes, which underlie neurological disorders. *International Awards :*Grand Hamdan International Award: ::*[[Colin L. Masters]] (Australia) - Molecular and Cellular Pathology of Neurological Disorders :*Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence: ::*[[Charles A. Dinarello]] (US) - Biology of Aging ::*[[Prof. Christian Hass]] (Germany) - Cytokines in Pathogenesis & Therapy of Diseases ::*[[Murray Esler]] (Australia) - Pathogenesis of Hypertension :*Hamdan Award for Volunteers in Humanitarian Medical Services: ::*[[Direct Aid]] (Kuwait) ::*[[Human Appeal International]] (UAE) ::*[[Magdi Yacoub]] (UK) *Arab World Awards :*Hamdan Award for the Best Medical College/Institute or Centre in the Arab World: ::*[[College of Medicine & Medical Sciences, Arabian Gulf University]] (Bahrain) ::*[[Urology & Nephrology Centre, Mansoura University]] (Egypt) *UAE Awards :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Individuals Working in the Field of Medicine & Health: ::*[[Dr. Mirza Ali Hassan Al Sayegh]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Muhammad Hassan Yasin]] (UAE) ::*[[H.E. Hamad Abdulrehman Al Midfaa]] (UAE) ::*[[Late Dr. Ahmad Yazbak]] (UAE) ::*[[Late Dr. Burwell (PAT) Kennedy]] and [[Dr. Marian Kennedy]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for an Outstanding Clinical Department in the Public Sector in UAE: ::*[[Thalassemia Centre, Al Wasl Hospital, Dubai]] (UAE) ::*[[Genetics Centre, Al Wasl Hospital, Dubai]] (UAE) ::*[[Sharjah Blood Transfusion and Research Center, Sharjah]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for Original Research Paper Published in HMJ from inside and outside UAE: ::*[[Dr. Hussein Saadi]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Maha Abdel Hadi]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Shahab Uddin]] (UAE) ::*[[Prof. Adekunle Hakim Dawodu]] (UAE) ===The fifth awards=== The topics of the fifth term, 2007-2008 were selected to be for Grand Hamdan International Award - Stem Cells Research, and for Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence - Therapy in Malignancy, Molecular Therapy in Drug Targeting (Pharmacogenomics), Organ & Tissue Transplantation. Stem cells are one of the most fascinating areas of biology today. Knowledge in this field has advanced in the area of healthy cell replacement of damaged cells and in the area of the development of an organism from a single cell, a promising area of science leading scientists to investigate the possibility of cell-based therapies to treat disease. Scientists have hypothesized that stem cells may be the basis of treating diseases like Parkinson's disease, diabetes, and heart disease. *International Awards :*Grand Hamdan International Award: ::*[[Donald Metcalf]] (Australia) - Stem Cell Research :*Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence: ::*[[Lee Sweeney|Dr. H. Lee Sweeney]] (US) - Molecular Therapy in Drug Targeting (Pharmacogenomics) ::*[[Axel Ullrich]] (Germany) - Therapy in Malignancy ::*[[Roy Yorke Calne]] (UK) - Organ & Tissue Transplantation :*Hamdan Award for Volunteers in Humanitarian Medical Services: ::*[[Hamdan bin Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan]] (UAE) ::*[[Marshal Abdurrahman Mohamed Hassan Swaruddahab]] (Sudan) ::*[[Proyecto Vision]] (Barcelona) ::*[[Society for Health Education]] (Republic of Maldives) *Arab World Awards :*Hamdan Award for the Best Medical College/Institute or Centre in the Arab World: ::*[[Faculty Of Medicine & Health Sciences, UAE University]] (UAE) ::*[[Syrian Center For Tobacco Studies]] (Syria) :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Distinguished Personalities from the Arab World: ::*[[Dr. Abdulrahman Al Awadhi and Dr. Sadika Al Awadhi]] (Kuwait) ::*[[Dr. Mohammed Mikati]] (Lebanon) *UAE Awards :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Individuals Working in the Field of Medicine & Health: ::*[[Dr. Salem AI Mahmood]] (UAE) ::*[[Mr. Abdulgani Mohammed Habib]] (UAE) ::*[[Mr. Mohammad Ibrahim Obaidullah]] (UAE) ::*Prof. [[Lihadh Al-Gazali]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for an Outstanding Clinical Department in the Public Sector in UAE: ::*[[Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Department, Rashid Hospital, Dubai]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for Original Research Paper Published in HMJ from inside and outside UAE: ::*[[Dr. Aburrahman I AI-Diab]] (KSA) ===The sixth awards=== The topics of the sixth term, 2009-2010 were selected to be for Grand Hamdan International Award - Diabetes Mellitus, and for Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence - Obesity, Osteoporosis, Thyroid Disease. Many questions about development of diabetes and its complications remain unanswered. For example, not all individuals are equally susceptible to diabetes or its complications. Differences in the genetic make-up of people, and perhaps differences in early-life conditions, must account for this. Finding genes or other markers associated with the development of diabetes and its complications potentially offers avenues for improved screening, diagnostics, and therapeutics. *International Awards :*Grand Hamdan International Award: ::*[[Prof. Jaakko Tuomilehto]] (Finland), [[Prof. Paul Zimmet]] (Australia) - Diabetes Mellitus :*Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence: ::*[[Jeffrey M. Friedman]] (US) - Obesity ::*[[Prof. John A. Kanis]] (UK) - Osteoporosis ::*[[Prof. P. Reed Larsen]] (US) - Thyroid Disorders :*Hamdan Award for Volunteers in Humanitarian Medical Services: ::*[[CURE International]] (US) ::*[[Dr. Ashok Gupta]] (India) ::*[[Prakash Amte]] and [[Mrs. Mandakini Amte]] (India) ::*[[Zayed Initiative Bid]] (UAE) *Arab World Awards :*Hamdan Award for the Best Medical College/Institute or Centre in the Arab World: ::*[[Department of Psychiatry and Clinical Psychology, St. George Medical Center]] (Lebanon) ::*[[Faculty of Medicine, Alexandria University]] (Egypt) :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Distinguished Personalities from the Arab World: ::*[[Dr. Hussein Al Gezairy]] (KSA) ::*[[Kamel Ajlouni]] (Jordan) *UAE Awards :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Individuals Working in the Field of Medicine & Health: ::*[[Abdullah Al Khayat]] (UAE) ::*[[Rashid Abdullah Al Nuaimi]] (UAE) ::*[[Late Prof.Dr.Salah El-Kalla]] (UAE) ::*[[Salma Al Sharhan]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for an Outstanding Clinical Department in the Public Sector in UAE: ::*[[Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Tawam Hospital, Al Ain]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for Original Research Paper Published in HMJ from inside and outside UAE: ::*[[Dr. Samir Attoub]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Ghazi Alsbeih]] (KSA) ===The seventh awards=== The topics of the seventh term, 2011-2012 were selected to be for Grand Hamdan International Award -Neonatal Medicine, and for Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence - Fetal Medicine, Nutrition in Infants, Inborn Errors of Metabolism. Benefits of antenatal care have been recognized by most mothers, and has resulted in the decrease in incidence of neural tube defects and the fetal alcohol syndrome. Complex new technologies like extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) and simple ones like the administration of surfactant resulted in increased survival of very small babies who would have succumbed to their illnesses a few years ago. *International Awards :*Grand Hamdan International Award: ::*[[Prof. Jeffrey Whitsett]] (US) - Neonatal Medicine :*Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence: ::*[[Nicholas Wald]] (UK) - Fetal Medicine ::*[[Prof. Rebecca A Simmons]] (US) - Nutrition in Infants ::*[[Prof. Ronald J A Wanders]] (Netherlands) - Inborn Errors of Metabolism :*Hamdan Award for Volunteers in Humanitarian Medical Services: ::*[[WAHA International]] (France) ::*[[Al Sabeel Association for Physically Disabled Children]] (Algeria) ::*[[Shershah Syed]] (Pakistan) *Arab World Awards :*Hamdan Award for the Best Medical College/Institute or Centre in the Arab World: ::*[[Faculty of Medicine, Kuwait University]] (Kuwait) ::*[[Prince Salman Center for Disability Research]] (KSA) :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Distinguished Personalities from the Arab World: ::*[[Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Al Rabiah]] (KSA) ::*[[Dr. Anna Rajab]] (Oman) *UAE Awards :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Individuals Working in the Field of Medicine & Health: ::*[[H.H. Sheikh Dr. Sultan bin Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan]] (UAE) ::*[[Prof. Dr. Mona Alrukhaimi]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Husnia Abdulla Ali Gargash]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Azan BinBrek]] (UAE) ::*[[Prof. Dr. Yousef Mohamed Abdulrazzaq Bastaki]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Amin Badri]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for an Outstanding Clinical Department in the Public Sector in UAE: ::*[[Department of Oncology, Tawam Hospital, Al Ain]] (UAE) ::*[[Cardiac Cath Lab Department, Al Qassimi Hospital, Sharjah]] (UAE) ::*[[Department of Neonatal Care, Latifa Hospital, Dubai]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for Original Research Paper Published in HMJ from inside and outside UAE: ::*[[Dr. Mahmoud Hag Ali]] (UAE) ===The eighth awards=== The topics of the 8th term, 2013-2014 were selected to be for Grand Hamdan International Award - Drug Discovery and for Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence - Vaccines, Targeted Therapy and Cell Therapy. *International Awards :*Grand Hamdan International Award: ::*[[Prof. Magid Abou Gharbia]] - Drug Discovery :*Hamdan Award for Medical Research Excellence: ::*Prof. [[Stanley Plotkin|Stanley A Plotkin]] - Vaccines ::*Prof. [[Carl June]] - Cell Therapy ::*Prof. [[Brian Druker|Brian J Druker]] - Targeted Therapy ::*Prof. [[Olle Ringden]] - Cell Therapy :*Hamdan Award for Volunteers in Humanitarian Medical Services: ::*Dr. [[Mads Fredrik Gilbert]] ::*Dr. [[Melvin Korkor]] ::*[[The Carter Center]] *Arab World Awards :*Hamdan Award for the Best Medical College/Institute or Centre in the Arab World: ::*[[Mongi Ben Hamida National Institute of neurology]] ::*College of Medicine & Health Sciences, [[Sultan Qaboos University]] :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Distinguished Personalities from the Arab World: ::*Prof. [[Mohamed Ghoneim]] ::*[[Dr. Zohair Yousef Al Halees]] *UAE Awards :*Hamdan Award for Honoring Individuals Working in the Field of Medicine & Health: ::*Late [[Abd Elsalam Rafie]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Ahmad Abdulaziz Al Jaziri]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Jamila Al Suwaidi]] (UAE) ::*[[Dr. Elham Mohamed Al Amiri]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for an Outstanding Clinical Department in the Public Sector in UAE: ::*Department of Pediatrics, [[Tawam Hospital]] (UAE) ::*[[Cardiology and Cardiothoracic Surgery Centre]] (UAE) :*Hamdan Award for Original Research Paper Published in Hamdan Medical Journal: ::*[[Dr. Sirag. Bennaser]] (UAE) ==CME Centre== The center is working on setting up the organizing procedures for supporting and managing conferences, scientific courses and medical symposiums to highlight the award leading role in the program fields, continuous medical education programs and community services through moral and financial support to medical events held in UAE, aiming to elevate the level of medical services, developing skills of medical staff and increasing health and cultural awareness level of community members. ===''Hamdan Medical Journal''=== The ''Hamdan Medical Journal'' (''HMJ'') is an online-only biomedical journal that presents original research, opinions and perspectives on aspects of international medicine. The journal publishes themed issues which provide summaries and reviews to help busy clinicians keep up to date with recent research and practice. The journal also publishes original research and other articles within each issue. The journal welcomes submissions, proposals and comments from medical practitioners around the world. ==Research Centre== The award is offering all financial and logistics facilities to support the scientific research process in the UAE through establishing the Research Support Center, including a selection of the best specialists, who are studying all the requests, arranging the awarding process, following up procedure of scientific research directions and recognizing scientific results for all the researches issued by educational institutions and research centers which will enrich scientific research and fill the gaps of the medical science studies and researches in UAE. ==See also== * [[Centre for Arab Genomic Studies]] == External links == * [http://www.hmaward.org.ae/ Sheikh Hamdan bin Rashid Al Maktoum Award for Medical Sciences] website * [http://www.cags.org.ae/ Centre for Arab Genomic Studies] website * [http://hamdanjournal.org/ ''Hamdan Medical Journal''] website [[Category:Medicine awards]] [[Category:Emirati science and technology awards]]

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=September 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2013}} {{Infobox book | name = The Sirian Experiments | title_orig = | image = Lessing SirianExperiments.jpg | caption = US first edition cover ([[Alfred A. Knopf]]) | author = [[Doris Lessing]] | cover_artist = Paul Gamarello | country = {{plainlist| *United States *United Kingdom }} | language = English | series = ''[[Canopus in Argos]]'' | genre = [[Novel]] ([[science fiction]]) | published = 1980 [[Alfred A. Knopf]], US, [[Jonathan Cape]], UK | media_type = Print (hardcover) | pages = 331 | isbn = 0-394-51231-6 | isbn_note = (US)
0-224-01891-4 (UK) | dewey = 823/.914 | congress = PR6023.E833 S57 1981 | oclc = 5941786 | preceded_by = [[The Marriages Between Zones Three, Four and Five]] | followed_by = [[The Making of the Representative for Planet 8]] }} '''''The Sirian Experiments''''' is a 1980 science fiction novel by [[Doris Lessing]]. It is the third book in her five-book ''[[Canopus in Argos]]'' series{{cite web |url=http://www.dorislessing.org/canopusin.html |title=Canopus in Argos: Archives |work=dorislessing.org |accessdate=14 October 2008}} and continues the story of [[Earth]]'s [[evolution]], which has been manipulated from the beginning by advanced [[extraterrestrial life|extraterrestrial civilisation]]s.{{cite news |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9F05E5DE143BF930A25752C0A967948260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all |title=Books of the Times: The Sirian Experiments |first=John |last=Leonard |authorlink=John Leonard (American critic) |work=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=14 October 2008 | date=13 January 1981}} It was first published in the United States in December 1980 by [[Alfred A. Knopf]], and in the United Kingdom in March 1981 by [[Jonathan Cape]]. The book was shortlisted for the [[List of winners and shortlisted authors of the Booker Prize|Booker Prize]] in 1981.{{cite web |url=http://themanbookerprize.com/fiction/1981 |title=The Man Booker Prize 1981 |work=[[Booker Prize]] |accessdate=25 June 2018}} ''The Sirian Experiments'' relates directly to the first book in this series, ''[[Shikasta]]'', which is the history of the planet Shikasta (an allegorical Earth) under the influence of three galactic empires, [[Canopus]], [[Sirius]] and their mutual enemy, Puttiora. ''Shikasta'' is told from the Canopean viewpoint.{{cite web |url=http://www.dorislessing.org/shikastaby.html |title=Shikasta |work=dorislessing.org |accessdate=14 October 2008}} ''The Sirian Experiments'' (subtitled ''The Report by Ambien II, of the Five'') tells the story of Shikasta from the Sirian point of view and describes the activities of Sirians on the planet and the strained relations of Sirius with Canopus.{{cite web |url=http://www.dorislessing.org/theexperiments.html |title=The Sirian Experiments |work=dorislessing.org |accessdate=14 October 2008}} Lessing stated in an [[afterword]] in the [[The Making of the Representative for Planet 8|next book]] in this series that ''The Sirian Experiments'' and ''[[The Making of the Representative for Planet 8]]'' were inspired by her 50-year fascination with the ill-fated [[Terra Nova Expedition|1910–13 Antarctic expedition]] of [[Robert Falcon Scott]].{{sfn|Lessing|1994c|loc="Afterword", p. 162}}{{cite news |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C00E3DD1F38F93AA15752C0A964948260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all |title=Books of the Times: The Making of the Representative for Planet 8 |first=Christopher |last=Lehmann-Haupt |authorlink=Christopher Lehmann-Haupt |work=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=14 October 2008 | date=29 January 1982}} ==Genre and reception== Because of its focus on characterisation and social/cultural issues, and the de-emphasis of technological details, ''The Sirian Experiments'' is not strictly science fiction but [[soft science fiction]], or "space fiction" as Lessing calls her ''Canopus in Argos'' series.{{sfn|Lessing|1994a|loc="Some Remarks", p. 8}} Robert Alter of ''[[The New York Times]]'' suggested that this kind of writing belongs to a genre [[literary critic]] [[Northrop Frye]] called the "anatomy", which is "a combination of fantasy and morality" and that "presents us with a vision of the world in terms of a single intellectual pattern."{{cite news |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9B07E3D8173BF932A25752C0A967948260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all |title=Doris Lessing in the Visionary Mode |work=[[The New York Times]] |first=Robert |last=Alter |accessdate=14 October 2008 | date=11 January 1981}} Lessing has stated that she has used this series as a vehicle to "put questions, both to myself and to others" and to "explore ideas and sociological possibilities."{{sfn|Lessing|1994b|loc="Preface", p. 11}} While Lessing's switch to "science fiction" in the late 1970s was not well received by all,{{cite web |url=http://mural.uv.es/vemivein/feminismcommunism.htm |title=Doris Lessing on Feminism, Communism and 'Space Fiction' |work=[[University of Valencia]] Press |first=Lesley |last=Hazelton |accessdate=14 October 2008}} the series in general has drawn positive criticism. Two reviews of ''The Sirian Experiments'' in ''The New York Times'' said that Lessing achieves "… a largeness of vision beyond the horizon of the conventional novel." and that it has "… some playful moments and some splendid ones. It is interesting, however, primarily because Doris Lessing wrote it." ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' on the other hand, which had spoken highly of the first two books in this series,{{cite news |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,947537,00.html |title=Visit to a Small Planet |first=Paul |last=Gray |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |accessdate=14 October 2008 | date=22 October 1979}}{{cite news |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,924037,00.html |title=Soul Mates |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |first=Paul |last=Gray |accessdate=14 October 2008 | date=21 April 1980}} felt that this one "may be a small misstep on a long journey."{{cite news |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,949106,00.html |title=More Lessing |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |first=Paul |last=Gray |accessdate=14 October 2008 | date=23 February 1981}} ==Plot== The Sirian Empire, centred in the [[Sirius]] star system, has advanced technology that made their citizens effectively immortal (barring accidents) and sophisticated machines that did almost everything for them. But this technology came at a price: many Sirians became afflicted with "the existentials", a debilitating malady that left them feeling worthless and with no reason to exist. To overcome this problem and give its people "something to do", Sirius embarked on a conquest of space and [[Colonisation|colonised]] many planets. But they also encroached on territory of the superior Canopean Empire that led to a costly war, which [[Canopus]] won. As a gesture of reconciliation, Canopus returned all the captured Sirian territory and invited Sirius to jointly colonise a new and promising planet called Rohanda (an allegorical [[Earth]]). Canopus took the northern continents and gave Sirius the southern continents. Ambien II, one of the Five who run the Sirian Colonial Service and also govern the Sirian Empire, represents Sirius on Rohanda. She sets in motion a series of [[biology|bio]]-[[Sociology|sociological]] and [[Genetics|genetic]] experiments where large numbers of primitive [[Indigenous peoples|indigenous people]] from Sirian colonised planets are space-lifted to Rohanda and adapted there for work elsewhere in the Empire. In the north, Canopus nurtures Rohanda's bourgeoning [[humanoid]]s and accelerates their [[evolution]]. They also put a Lock on the planet that links it to the harmony and strength of the Canopean Empire. Canopus keeps Ambien II updated with reports of all their work, but she is suspicious of Sirius's former enemy, seeing them as a competitor rather than a partner, and is unable to correctly interpret them. Then an unforeseen "cosmic re-alignment" breaks the Lock and Shammat of the malicious Puttiora Empire begins exploiting the situation by corrupting Rohanda's Natives. Canopus, seeing Rohanda decline, renames the planet [[Shikasta]] (the stricken). Sirius, unconcerned about Canopus's troubles in the north, continue to refer to the planet as Rohanda. In an attempt to foster better relations with Sirius, Klorathy, a senior Canopean Colonial administrator, invites Ambien II to observe events in their territory. Ambien II, eager to learn more about Canopus, agrees. As Rohanda evolves and civilisations come and go, Ambien II and Klorathy meet several times to watch Rohanda's degeneration. Canopus does what it can to help communities, but with Shammat's evil and a broken Lock, they make little progress. From time to time Klorathy requests Ambien II's help and while working on the planet, she meets Nasar, another Canopean official. She also encounters Tafta, the Shammat commander on Rohanda, and at one point nearly succumbs to his corruption. Ambien II eventually abandons the Sirian Experiments in the south when they are overrun by Shammat. The Five want her to abandon Rohanda altogether, but she has become too attached to the planet and is warming to Canopus and seeing the error of her (and Sirius's) ways. The Five question her ties to their former enemy, but when she tries to explain herself, they do not hear what she is saying, just as she initially could not hear what Canopus was saying. The Five then send her to Planet 13 on "corrective exile" to write a report on what has happened (this book). When she later releases the report, the Five issues a statement denying the authenticity of Ambien II's work. ==Characters== ;Sirius *The Five – peer group of five senior administrators of the Sirian Colonial Service *Ambien II – one of the Five, Sirian representative to Rohanda ;Canopus *Klorathy – senior Canopean Colonial administrator *Nasar – permanent official on Rohanda ;Shammat *Tafta – Shammat representative to Rohanda ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==Works cited== *{{cite book | last = Lessing | first = Doris | authorlink = Doris Lessing | title = Shikasta | origyear = 1979 | year = 1994a | publisher = Flamingo | location = London | isbn = 0-00-712776-6 | ref = harv}} *{{cite book | last = Lessing | first = Doris | authorlink = Doris Lessing | title = The Sirian Experiments | origyear = 1980 | year = 1994b | publisher = Flamingo | location = London | isbn = 0-00-654721-4 | ref = harv}} *{{cite book | last = Lessing | first = Doris | authorlink = Doris Lessing | title = The Making of the Representative for Planet 8 | origyear = 1982 | year = 1994c | publisher = Flamingo | location = London | isbn = 0-00-654718-4 | ref = harv}} == Further reading == *{{cite book | last = Fahim | first = Shadia S. | authorlink = | title = Doris Lessing: Sufi Equilibrium and the Form of the Novel | publisher = Palgrave Macmillan/St. Martins Press | year = 1995 | location = Basingstoke, UK/New York, NY | isbn = 0-312-10293-3}} * {{cite book | last = Galin | first = Müge | authorlink = | title = Between East and West: Sufism in the Novels of Doris Lessing | publisher = State University of New York Press | year = 1997 | location = Albany, NY | isbn = 0-7914-3383-8}} ==External links== *[http://www.dorislessing.org/theexperiments.html ''The Sirian Experiments''] at dorislessing.org. * {{isfdb title|8283}} *[http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,949106,00.html "More Lessing"]. ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' review. *[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9B07E3D8173BF932A25752C0A967948260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all "Doris Lessing in the Visionary Mode"]. ''[[The New York Times]]'' book review. *[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9F05E5DE143BF930A25752C0A967948260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all "Books of the Times"]. ''[[The New York Times]]'' book review. {{Doris Lessing}} {{Portal bar|Literature}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sirian Experiments, The}} [[Category:1980 British novels]] [[Category:1980 science fiction novels]] [[Category:Canopus in fiction]] [[Category:Novels by Doris Lessing]] [[Category:British science fiction novels]] [[Category:Alfred A. Knopf books]] [[Category:Jonathan Cape books]] [[Category:Sequel novels]] [[Category:Sirius in fiction]] [[Category:Social science fiction]]

''The Three Amigos'' is a series of 20 [[public service announcements]] (PSA) using three animated [[condoms]] to promote the use of [[safe sex]] as protection from contacting the [[HIV/AIDS]] virus. First shown at [http://www.iasociety.org/Default.aspx?pageId=11&abstractId=2172132 Bangkok's XV International AIDS Conference in 2004], the series was officially launched at the [https://www.un.org/News/briefings/docs/2005/HIV_AIDSbrf050111.doc.htm United Nations in 2005] in six languages. By 2012 it had been broadcast or used by [[NGOs]], educational institutions, hospitals and others in 150 countries in 45 languages.
The series was co-created by Chocolate Moose Media's [[Firdaus Kharas]] and South African writer [http://www.linkedin.com/pub/brent-quinn/4/255/48a Brent Quinn]. Episodes approach the subject with humor and are shown in 15-, 20-, 30- and 60-second animated spots. The hand-drawn animation series contains 14,000 drawings and was produced completely by volunteers in four countries. ''The Three Amigos'' campaign won a [[Peabody Award]] in 2006<ref>[http://www.peabodyawards.com/award-profile/the-three-amigos-hiv-aids-prevention-programme 66th Annual Peabody Awards], May 2007.</ref> as well as 29 other international awards, and has been the subject of numerous articles<ref>{{cite web |work=[[The New Yorker]] |title=Pitching Rubbers |url=http://www.newyorker.com/archive/2004/05/24/040524ta_talk_mcgrath |date=May 24, 2004 }}</ref> and [[academic writing]].<ref>{{cite web |last=von Flotow |first=Luise |title=The (Globalized) Three Amigos |url=http://www.erudit.org/revue/ttr/2005/v18/n2/015770ar.html }}</ref> Distribution to all users throughout the world is free.
Worldwide dissemination has coincided with a significant decrease in new AIDS cases, according to [http://www.unaids.org/en/dataanalysis/ UNAIDS statistics].<ref>{{cite web |publisher=[[UNAIDS]] |title=AIDS Epidemic Update 2009 |pages=11 ff. |url=http://www.unaids.org/en/media/unaids/contentassets/dataimport/pub/report/2009/jc1700_epi_update_2009_en.pdf |accessdate=May 11, 2012 |format=PDF }}</ref> Part of the result has come through staunch public support by people like Nobel Peace Prize laureate Archbishop [[Desmond Tutu]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Tutu |first=Desmond |authorlink=Desmond Tutu |title=Letter of Support |url=http://www.thethreeamigos.org/pdf/LetterfromArchTutu.pdf |work=May 11, 2012 |format=PDF }}</ref> The campaign is also highlighted in a documentary film about Kharas's work called ''[[Firdaus Kharas: The Animated Activist]]''.
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.thethreeamigos.org/ ''The Three Amigos''] * [http://www.kharas.ca/ Firdaus Kharas]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Three Amigos Campaign, The}} [[Category:Public service announcements]] [[Category:HIV/AIDS prevention organizations]]
